resources.string: Not a member? Sign up now.

General Information
The MedFC app project is a research collaboration between the Departments of Pharmacy and Electrical & Computer Engineering, National University of Singapore. Please visit the ‘About Us’ section on the MedFC website for details of the research team.

By using this product, you acknowledge the acceptance of the following terms and conditions, including the restrictions, disclaimers and limitations. You agree that we are not responsible for the results of your decisions resulting from the use of the product. This includes, but is not limited to, your choice of whether to seek or not to seek professional medical care, specific medical treatments and/or drug therapy.

About MedFC app
MedFC is a smartphone app intended for patients with chronic medical conditions and/or their caregivers. The purpose of the app is to help patients manage their medications easily through monitoring of their medication adherence patterns and clinical outcomes. The app provides a variety of functionalities including medication reminders, source of medication information, recording of symptoms related to medication side effects or disease condition, and a means for tracking medication taking patterns. This app also allows healthcare providers to monitor their patients’ medication adherence patterns through a clinician interface.

The MedFC app is intended to complement patients’ current methods of monitoring medication adherence. Patients should not and must not solely rely on the app for taking their medications on time. In cases where any hardware or software on the user’s device prevents the app from operating as intended or is broken, or if the power is turned off, or if the app is not enabled, MedFC may not function as intended. As a patient user, you acknowledge that MedFC’s reminder system depends on the preferences that you make in the settings of the app and/or your smartphone, and information that you enter, if you choose to change the details of your medication schedule that is programed by your health professional.

The contents of the MedFC app are not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis or treatment. Patients should always seek the advice of their physician, pharmacist or other qualified health provider with any questions they may have regarding their medications or medical condition. Every effort has been made to ensure that the app contains accurate and up-to- date medication information, but no guarantee is made to that effect. We are not responsible for any misinterpretation of medication information by the user. Additionally, the medication information contained herein may also be time sensitive. Reliance on any information accessed through the MedFC app is solely at the user’s own risk.

About the MedFC application
The MedFC application has three components: (1) clinician interface, (2) patient interface, (3) caregiver interface.

The clinician interface is intended for clinicians who are involved in the supply of medicines and provision of pharmaceutical care to patients. The interface enables the clinician to enter patient details including their names, the name and dosages of their medications and other medication-related information. This information will be utilized to encode a Near Field Communication (NFC) sticker that will be part of the labelling on the patient’s medication package. The clinician can also monitor the patient’s medication adherence patterns and reported symptoms. Information required during signup for access to this application includes, the user’s full name, NRIC/FIN, email address, and login password. The collected information is stored for as long as the user has access to the interface and can only be accessed by the MedFC Team, for the purpose of analysing user statistics. No information will be revealed to any third party for advertising or other purposes except those cases where we are obliged to reveal the information by a court order.

The patient web interface is designed as a convenient way for patients to monitor their medication adherence levels. The caregiver interface enables caregivers to track the medication adherence patterns of the patient they care for. The patient has to endorse the caregiver before access is granted, unless in exceptional cases.

Privacy Policy
Any personally identifiable information collected from the usage of the app remains highly confidential and will not be used for any other purpose besides facilitating the usage of the app. The app will access patient’s personal information entered in the clinician’s web interface. Personal information collected includes the user’s full name, and NRIC number. The details of the medications that the patient takes are also accessed. The app also collects symptom information that patients enter. The collected information is stored in the MedFC database for as long as the user has access to the app and can only be accessed by his/her healthcare professional, and the MedFC Team for the purpose of analysing user statistics. No information will be revealed to any third party for advertising or other purposes except those cases where we are obliged to reveal the information by a court order.

Advertising
The MedFC app is a non-commercial app developed by a collaboration between the Departments of Pharmacy and Electrical & Computer Engineering, National University of Singapore. The app is not sponsored by any other organisation and is not funded by advertising. The MedFC team does not have any direct conflict of interest with any commercial organiszation or organiszations that may bias the information provided by the app.

The MedFC website does not intentionally use cookies. Cookies can be disabled from the settings menu of your Internet browser. ( Internet Explorer,  Firefox, Safari,  Google Chrome)

User Risks
The absence of a warning for a given medication or combination of medications does not indicate that the medication or medication combination is safe, effective or appropriate for any given patient and should not be interpreted as such. By using the MedFC app and clinician interface, the user acknowledges that he/she has been made aware of the disclaimers in this agreement, including those which state that the app is not a substitute for professional advice, and that the MedFC team and their institutions make no warranty on the accuracy, validity, completeness or availability of the information cited in this app.

Contact us:
Please visit the ‘Contact Us’ section on the MedFC website.

Per Dosage
Amount of medicine that you need to take every time
Balance
The amount of medicine that you have left
Consumption Time
The time when you are required to take your medication
